content: “I spend too much time on social media” is a privileged complaint in the grand scheme, to be sure. But all in all, my friends and I are increasingly ending our days wired and anxious, tired as if we’d labored for money, yet feeling emptier. The percentage of women choosing to skip motherhood has doubled since the 1970s, and while there are all kinds of generational and economic factors involved, I wonder: What if women today just feel like we’re all out of love?
